unnormalised: **Entertainment News: Bollywood Braces for a Box Office Tsunami!**
normalised: **Entertainment News: Bollywood Braces for a Box Office Tsunami!**

unnormalised: Mumbai – It's raining movies this Diwali! Bollywood is unleashing a barrage of films, hoping to cash in on the festive season. Prepare for release dates popping up faster than diyas on 24/10/2024.
normalised: Mumbai – It is raining movies this Diwali! Bollywood is unleashing a barrage of films, hoping to cash in on the festive season. Prepare for release dates popping up faster than diyas on twenty fourth October two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: First, we have Dharma Productions' *Prem ki Pizza*, a rom-com that promises more cheese than a Mumbai pizzeria. Early screenings suggest viewers might need antacids by the interval. Next up, Anurag Kashyap tries his hand at a family drama (yes, really!) titled *Rishton ka Raasta*, scheduled to hit cinemas at exactly 11:45 AM on 25/10/2024.
normalised: First, we have Dharma Productions' *Prem ki Pizza*, a rom-com that promises more cheese than a Mumbai pizzeria. Early screenings suggest viewers might need antacids by the interval. Next up, Anurag Kashyap tries his hand at a family drama (yes, really!) titled *Rishton ka Raasta*, scheduled to hit cinemas at exactly eleven forty five A M on twenty fifth October two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: But wait, there's more! Rumour has it that even veteran actor Mithun Chakraborty is making a comeback with a disco-themed thriller. Sources whisper of a midnight release on 26/10/2024 in select theatres only.
normalised: But wait, there is more! Rumour has it that even veteran actor Mithun Chakraborty is making a comeback with a disco-themed thriller. Sources whisper of a midnight release on twenty sixth October two thousand and twenty four in select theatres only.

unnormalised: Can these films recover their massive Rs. 100 crore budgets? Will audiences choose blockbusters over bursting crackers? Only time (and box office numbers) will tell! Stay tuned for our full review (assuming we survive the cinematic onslaught).
normalised: Can these films recover their massive rupee one hundred crore budgets? Will audiences choose blockbusters over bursting crackers? Only time (and box office numbers) will tell! Stay tuned for our full review (assuming we survive the cinematic onslaught).
